description: Criminals are now texting T-Mobile and Verizon employees on their personal and work phones, trying to tempt them with cash to perform SIM swaps. [...]
title: T-Mobile, Verizon workers get texts offering $300 for SIM swaps

description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has reached a settlement with telehealth firm Cerebral in which the company will pay $7,000,000 over allegations of mishandling people's sensitive health data. [...]
title: Cerebral to pay $7 million settlement in Facebook pixel data leak case

description: Ivanti has released security updates to fix 27 vulnerabilities in its Avalanche mobile device management (MDM) solution, two of them critical heap overflows that can be exploited for remote command execution. [...]
title: Ivanti warns of critical flaws in its Avalanche MDM solution

description: Exploit code is now available for a maximum severity and actively exploited vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks' PAN-OS firewall software. [...]
title: Exploit released for Palo Alto PAN-OS bug used in attacks, patch now

description: YouTube announced yesterday that third-party applications that block ads while watching YouTube videos violates its Terms of Service (ToS), and it will soon start taking action against the apps. [...]
title: Google to crack down on third-party YouTube apps that block ads

description: Cisco warns about a large-scale credential brute-forcing campaign targeting VPN and SSH services on Cisco, CheckPoint, Fortinet, SonicWall, and Ubiquiti devices worldwide. [...]
title: Cisco warns of large-scale brute-force attacks against VPN services

description: A vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-31497 in PuTTY 0.68 through 0.80 could potentially allow attackers with access to 60 cryptographic signatures to recover the private key used for their generation. [...]
title: PuTTY SSH client flaw allows recovery of cryptographic private keys
